summary: An Ordinance providing for the improvement of Twenty-sixth Avenue North, from East Madison Street to East Helen Street, all in the City of Seattle, by grading and curbing the same, in accordance with Resolution No. 123 of the City Council of the City of Seattle, and providing for the payment therefor by the mode of "Payment by Bonds," as provided by an act of the Legislature of the State of Washington, entitled "An act authorizing issuance and sale of bonds by cities, to pay for local improvements, providing for the payment thereof, and declaring an emergency," approved March 14, 1899, and Ordinance No. 5693 of said city, approved December 6, 1899.
